timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a map item. Selected by the Material the block uses.
          
          
            
            	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MaterialColor
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor
+	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a map item. Selected by the Material the block uses.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.
          
          
            
            	COMMENT Represents the surface color of a block when rendered from the {@link net.minecraft.client.gui.MapRenderer}.
timeline.author: ChloeDawn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MaterialColor
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor
+	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.

replies.bodyText: "Selected by the Material the block uses." is redundant and confusing. That is a property of materials, not the color. And a map color can be specified for a block that is unrelated to the material.
replies.author: ChloeDawn

timeline.message: Merge branch 'material-clor-improvements' of https://github.com/dexman545/yarn into material-clor-improvements

timeline.bodyText: Why is Top necessary here? As described in the documentation, map colors represent the surface color of the block. This is just a blockstate sensitive getter for the map color, no?
timeline.author: ChloeDawn

timeline.bodyText: What is "default" about this? Does it not just return the blocks map color as defined by the settings?
timeline.author: ChloeDawn

replies.bodyText: It pulls the default blockstate for the color
replies.author: dexman545

timeline.bodyText: What makes this a factory? Is it constructing new colors? If not, it is a provider.
timeline.author: ChloeDawn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -220,10 +220,10 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_4970 net/minecraft/block/AbstractBlock
 		FIELD field_23186 emissiveLightingPredicate Lnet/minecraft/class_4970$class_4973;
 		METHOD <init> (Lnet/minecraft/class_3614;Ljava/util/function/Function;)V
 			ARG 1 material
-			ARG 2 materialColorFactory
+			ARG 2 mapColorFactory

replies.bodyText: Might have been matcher, since one of the constructors is a Function<BlockState, MapColor>
replies.author: i509VCB
